summary: This is an affidavit from an AT&T Legal Compliance Analyst verifying the authenticity of AT&T subscriber and call detail records. The records were originally provided without certification, purged, and then mailed to the National Compliance Center by Christian R. Everdell. The affidavit attests to the records' format and business practices.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Mailed the AT&T records to the National Compliance Center on October 14, 2021.

persons.name: James E. Finklea
persons.context: Swore to and subscribed the affidavit before a notary public; appears to be the AT&T Legal Compliance Analyst and Custodian of Records making the verification.

events.title: Mailing of AT&T Records
events.description: Christian R. Everdell mailed AT&T subscriber and call detail records to the National Compliance Center.

events.title: AT&T Record Creation
events.description: Based on AT&T's regular practices in 2008, the records were made at or near the time of each act, event, condition, opinion, or diagnosis, and kept in the course of regularly conducted business activity.

keyFacts: AT&T records were originally provided without certification and have been purged, making them unable to be recreated in the same format.
The affidavit verifies that the attached AT&T subscriber and call detail records appear unmodified and are consistent with AT&T's record-keeping practices.
The records were mailed to the National Compliance Center on October 14, 2021, by Christian R. Everdell.
